trans-unit.source: Represents a column header in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.SortGlyphDirection%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SortOrder.None>.
Creates an exact copy of this cell.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the cloned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell"></xref>.
Creates a new accessible object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell"></xref>.

If you do not explicitly call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.AccessibilityObject%2A> property is referenced.
To get or set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.AccessibilityObject%2A>, you must add a reference to the `Accessibility` assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell"></xref>.
Retrieves the formatted value of the cell to copy to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard"></xref>.

Depending on the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ClipboardCopyMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control, this method is called by the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.GetClipboardContent%2A> method to retrieve a clipboard-formatted value that represents the cell.

The position-related parameters of this method indicate where this cell is located in the table of data representing the region defined by the selected cells in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
Depending on the cell's position, formatting information may be returned by this method in addition to the cell value.
For example, the HTML format for a cell in the first column of a row will include the tag that indicates the beginning of a row.

The supported clipboard formats include <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataFormats.Text?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataFormats.UnicodeText?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataFormats.Html?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataFormats.CommaSeparatedValue?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard> class.
The zero-based index of the row containing the cell.
`true` to indicate that the cell is in the first column of the region defined by the selected cells; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate that the cell is the last column of the region defined by the selected cells; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate that the cell is in the first row of the region defined by the selected cells; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate that the cell is in the last row of the region defined by the selected cells; otherwise, `false`.
The current format string of the cell.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the value of the cell to copy to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Clipboard"></xref>.
rowIndex is not -1.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's content area, which is calculated using the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> object and cell style.
The size of the cell's contents is computed dynamically when this method is called.
This method is called internally when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ContentBounds%2A> property is read.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's contents.
rowIndex is not -1.
Retrieves the inherited shortcut menu for the specified row.
The index of the row to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> of.
The index must be -1 to indicate the row of column headers.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> of the column headers if one exists; otherwise, the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> inherited from <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
rowIndex is not -1.
Gets the style applied to the cell.

This method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> that inherits its settings from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> objects returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersDefaultCellStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DefaultCellStyle%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
For more information, see [Cell Styles in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/cell-styles-in-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be populated with the inherited cell style.
The index of the cell's parent row.
`true` to include inherited colors in the returned cell style; otherwise, `false`.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that includes the style settings of the cell inherited from the cell's parent row, column, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
rowIndex is not -1.
Calculates the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that represents the style of the cell.
The zero-based row index of the cell.
The cell's maximum allowable size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
rowIndex is not -1.
Gets the value of the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The value contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell"></xref>.
rowIndex is not -1.
Paints the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to paint the cell.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that needs to be repainted.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the bounds of the cell that is being painted.
The row index of the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that specifies the state of the cell.
The data of the cell that is being painted.
The formatted data of the cell that is being painted.
An error message that is associated with the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that contains formatting and style information about the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle"></xref> that contains border styles for the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewPaintParts"></xref> values that specifies which parts of the cell need to be painted.
Sets the value of the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The cell value to set.
`true` if the value has been set; otherwise `false`.
rowIndex is not -1.
Gets or sets a value indicating which sort glyph is displayed.

This property is set automatically for columns with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode?displayProperty=fullName>.

You must set this property yourself when sorting by columns with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SortOrder"></xref> value representing the current glyph.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SortOrder.None"></xref>.
The specified value when setting this property is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SortOrder"></xref> value.

When setting this property, the value of either the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OwningColumn"></xref> property or the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.DataGridView"></xref> property of the cell is `null`.
-or-

When changing the value of this property, the specified value is not <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SortOrder.None"></xref> and the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode"></xref> property of the owning column is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode.NotSortable"></xref>.
Returns the string representation of the cell.
A string that represents the current cell.
